Reviews.Title: “Good hotel , fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: RoseRotherham
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice, once a few years ago when it was just me and my husband. It did need some updating but when we found out how near we were to everything we didn't mind. Last time we went as a mixed group and booked the hotel again because of the location but found that the hotel had been updated. You cannot fault the location and the price, if you want 4-5 stars then you should be prepared to pay for it, Everything is clean and we actually liked the breakfast at the Irish bar next door.Overall a good hotel, great location and great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterMartin1987
Reviews.Content: I read a number of reviews before arriving to the hotel and was quite worried as most seemed to be negative. However, I can honestly say that I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel for a number of reasons. The location of the hotel is brilliant (2 minute walk from the central station and red light district) and the rooms were of a good standard. The reception was nice and most of the time the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only negative was the view from the bedroom window (another building) but this wouldn't stop me visiting again, especially at the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, amazing breakfast, don't expect much..”
Reviews.Author: Nazano E Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are not so fust about a place to crash.. Then I certainly would recommend this place.. Close to everything there is in Amsterdam.. Spent 5 days there, I had no complaint.. Because I choose the location..if you want A star service with comfortable relax environment then you are at the wrong place..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikedave
Reviews.Content: Nice central hotel lots to see and do lovely to sit by the canal

Reviews.Title: “claires 40th”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location , but the room had a window that looked into the service duct where all the pipework was installed no natural light and it was boiling we nicknamed our room the sweat box . staff were friendly if i was on a stag weekend no worries but i was with the wife . our friends went for cheap and we got it it was clean tho .also they did not charge your card till you got to the hotel so it worked out more expensive than we thought "naughty". would not go back here out of choice .

Reviews.Title: “A suprisingly great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Orlieanne
Reviews.Content: Before heading to Amsterdam, I decided to read other Trip Advisor reviews on this hotel. I admit that I was very worried about coming to the France Hotel which was already booked by a friend, as the majority of the reviews were terrible. However, I was pleasantly suprised when we arrived. The staff during the day are kind and approachable, and very willing to help with anything you may need, (We'd forgotten an iron and travel plugs, both of which they offered, as well as directions and advise on where to eat). The location of the hotel is perfect as it is within walking distance from everywhere. It is a five minute walk from the train station, all pubs and restaurants, as well as having near by shops. We got our breakfast in the pub next door which was average but included with the room so we couldn't complain! It's about 10 minutes away from the RLD, so far away enough to avoid it but close enough if you want to go and see it. Your also on a canal so whilst our room didnt have a great view, I'm sure some rooms do. The staff at night (one man inparticular) is extremley bad mannered and rude, however a complaint will be made directly to the hotel, and I would not let this influence us returning. It was a great, CLEAN (this was something i was espiecally worried about), low budget and central hotel, and I would recommend it to anyone going to Amsterdam. I travelled with my boyfriend and three other friends, and we were all happy enough with the hotel. We had a late flight home and the staff kindly held on to our bags as we walked around Amsterdam and went for a meal. I liked the hotel and I strongly think people going there should ignore bad reviews, as for a central, cheap hotel, it wouldn't get much better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: garrysother
Reviews.Content: Ok so when we booked this hotel it was marked as 4star on flight centre website, try 1 star. The hotel is filthy, the floors and bedding are dirty and the staff are rude, it's also smack bang in the middle of the red light district. I paid a fortune for this hotel (no refund of course) didn't end up staying, checked into another hotel Victoria Park Plaz, better location 4star and cheaper

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Christina A
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel, new management is aware of some previous concerns before takeover but are definitely trying to listen to their customers and are genuine in their attempts to ensure cistomers are satisfied. Fantastic breakfast at the Irish Pub next door, (dinner is not bad either, big servings). Great location, easy walk from Central station and 10minuites walk to great shopping strip. We had additional suitcases and management was kind enough to hold these while we were in Paris/Bonn/Berlin before returning for three more nights on our way back to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful with a good location”
Reviews.Author: tuckgerg02
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Amsterdam and we booked as a cheap last min....we didn't expect too much from The hotel but I think value wise it was brilliant! The beds are comfy and the showed powerful! :-) The location is brilliant if u want to be with in walking distance of most the places! At first it was hard to Find but once I equipped myself With a map we found our way around!!! I have to say the best part of the holiday was walking around all the canals finding brilliant little cafes, homemade cake shops and excellent steak houses!! Although I did massively blow my budget on food! 100% recommend the tripadvisor iPhone app it made our holiday but cost me a fortune in restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Hotel's all round service.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a great spot close to the train station & bars. The hotel itself was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in the basement to which we were pre-warned, the room was basic with no windows (which felt strange to sleep in) but was clean, tidy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: sam G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION RIGHT IN CENTRE BUT STILL QUIET ENOUGH TO SLEEP! BREAKFAST WAS GREAT IN THE PUB NEXT DOOR! DON'T BE LATE THO THEY STOP BANG ON TIME! 5 minute walk to central station right on red light district door step, staff friendly and helpful and half 11 check out was good. They will keep your bags for the day too which was a bonus. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Amsterdam Visit”
Reviews.Author: Crystal R
Reviews.Content: Although the comments were not very positive, we gave it a try. It was a great experience, clean room, value for money, and friendly staff. Also the breakfast in the Irish pub was nice. Therefore give it a try when you come to Amsterdam and want to stay not expensive, but in basic proper room, is it a great place.

Reviews.Title: “solide, clean, no frills !”
Reviews.Author: Matthew h
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first week of january, good basic budget hotel in great location. Solid, clean, no frills stay, wouldn't hesitate to go back on my next visit to Amsterdam. PS: definitely ask Will for restaurant Recommendations, she's great!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs.....yes please!”
Reviews.Author: jarumagu
Reviews.Content: I found bed bugs in the room I was staying in.....moved to another room....no bug to be seen, but people in the elevator told me they had bugs in their room :O! I would rate this place as a stay away...so so service and an excuse that "this is Amsterdam and very common to have bed bugs" ...whatever, should change the name to Dirty Bird Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: CityHopper1234
Reviews.Content: We got an inner room and it was stuffy and stank of stale smoke and had no window. If you want breakfast you are directed next door to an Irish bar which was great and at night even better. This Hotel is in a great location but is let down by the interior.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: 77love2travel
Reviews.Content: After having booked a hostel and realising it was outside of the city, my friends and I walked into several hotels and when coming across France Hotel and having a look at one of the rooms figured it would be ok to stay at. Nothing special about the rooms, the toilet was not in a great condition. It was fine for what it was as I was with friends and laughed this kind of thing off and we spent most of our time in the city. The one good thing about it is the location but overall, would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “the worst memory of amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: antonis m
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this hotel and i can tell you that you must avoid staying there.The first day we arrived we found a used razor blade at the bathroom.. toilet was very dirty, seems that they had many years to clean it. At the first day we bought a clorine and leave it all night inside , the next morning the buttom of the toilet became white!! it was a suprise!! the room wasn't the cleaniest.. also there was problem with soundproof. When someone was walking outside the room you thought that there were in the room!!! The room view also wasn't nice, you could see only the wall of the next building. The last day also we had a "suprise". We look below the beds and we found a used bag of chips!!! It wasn't ours! -1 star hotel should be!! The only good that this hotel had , was the breakfast(a tavern near hotel) and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Beds not the best”
Reviews.Author: roseb59
Reviews.Content: After reading the latest reviews i think we may have had bed bugs too at the time i wasnt sure but the bed did not have a mattress protector and the mattress was not the cleanest breakfast was good and staff helpfull my son stayed in a back packers hostel a few streets away for a week and loved it maybe next time we will stay there for a quarter the price

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Ben C
Reviews.Content: We spent the 5th to the 8th of October in this bug pit even though my partner was fine I took my normal allergic reaction to insect bites or in this case bed bugs, doctor wasn't sure at first whether it was chicken pox or bite reaction, I look like I have the mange . . I recommend you stay in a place that cleans or fumigates matresses, maybe hard to find in Amsterdam as accommodation is expensive and mediocre at times but the France Hotel is for sure not a pleasurable experience, STAY AWAY . . .

Reviews.Title: “Room without window!”
Reviews.Author: melpok
Reviews.Content: Paid a lot of money for a room without window!! Second night they moved us to another room with just a small window high up. So disappointed.... So much difference with the picture of hotel room on internet. Be careful with that detail and assure that you will have a proper room before going there. Almost spoiled our weekend break...

Reviews.Title: “Don't book, you would be better in a hostel.”
Reviews.Author: London141
Reviews.Content: Expensive, shabby, no food in hotel ( breakfast was in the pub next door ), ensuite facilities were older than me! In general a really poor hotel not even worth a 1 star rating and it says it is a 3 star - that's a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Passable- good”
Reviews.Author: Glen111
Reviews.Content: We spend from th 20th to the 25th of september in this hotel. We stayed in a room at the third floor. While there was no window, the room was overall clean, the bathroom clean, and we also had a tv. Its location is great, and at night it was fairly quiet, allowing good rest. The breakfast was humble but still enough. The matresses are a bit old though.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Galore”
Reviews.Author: Usafa00
Reviews.Content: Within 20 minutes of checking in, we could see 4 bedbugs on the beds and they were even crawling up the walls. Watch out for room 104. When we complained, we were moved to a room on the 4th floor and it seems to be bedbug free. Trust me, we ripped the room apart looking before we went to sleep. Customer service is nice and the location is fantastic, but the bedbug thing isn't far from the front of my find anytime I'm on bed. I just hope they don't mKe their way into my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but that's where it ends.”
Reviews.Author: claremoran
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Amsterdam were booked solid this weekend and I had to book France hotel. I had read reviews but had no option. This hotel was 700 Euro for 3 nights. It's more like a youth hostel or Homeless Acommodation. Rooms are poor, tiny, clean enough although bedding stained on arrival. Quite miserable staff, sometimes lucky to get a hello. Not a cheap hotel but in a great location for everything. Wouldn't go again

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, rooms so-so”
Reviews.Author: matshanssen
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location, not far from Central Station, nor the Red Light District and Zeedijk. Its on a quiet side street, next to a canal. We stayed here because we found a good price at one of the hotel booking websites, and the location was very nice. The room itself is not so good. Its small and claustrophobic (no windows). We stayed here for one night, and basically just slept and showered here. If you want a more comfortable room, you either need to increase your budget and go for one of their more expencive alternatives (although I dont know how good those rooms are), or consider another hotel (there are plenty in this area).

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EVEN BOTHER!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Badboy41
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the France Hotel last weekend for 3 nights (21st July) and at first glance we thought it was a great location 5 mins to Central Station and 2-3 mins to Red Light District, BUT thats where it ended . Had to pay upfront for the first time ever at an Amsterdam Hotel? asked for a three bed room but got two beds and a Z bed, Asked on reception to change room to one with three proper beds but could only do the next day. OK I can live for that for one night, Well the bed broke as soon as I got in it that night but I suppose it was lucky I'd had a few drinks so didn't really notice that much till the early hours of the morning when my back was killing me. In the morning some rude eastern european was on the desk and was basically telling us that we would have exactly the same problem in the room that we were going to change to and kept shrugging his shoulders as if to say just make do with what we've already got. Still changed room to one with three beds, no windows and the air con didn't work but having said that it was clean,tidy, had a fair sized bathroom and anything was better than what we'd just come from, didn't experience the dreaded bed bugs though! Overall though it is not a very nice place to stay especially as it cost nearly 500 euros for 3 nights for what is basically a dive, infact I have stayed at youth hostels better than this. If you want to go somewhere that is good and for just a few more euros try a the Avenue Hotel its absoulutely cracking, plus you get a proper English buffet style breakfast or continental breakfast your choice? especially

Reviews.Title: “better than i expected”
Reviews.Author: higgins68
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from the france hotel. Was worried about going because of the reviews, but glad i didn't cancel. Firstly the location is perfect, bang in the center of the red light district. The rooms we had on the 4th floor was basic but very clean, we heard no noise from any other rooms, no bed bugs!! the shower in our room 404 not too great, but room 406 power shower. The reception staff really friendly and couldn't do enough for you. Breakfast next door ok, cereal, toast, fruit, eggs, ham and cheeses. We stopped at this hotel 4 year ago and also enjoyed it then. Maybe we just lucky with rooms but couldn't fault hotel for price paid.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs infestation!”
Reviews.Author: 186338Antonia
Reviews.Content: the room appeared clean at first but after staying four nights, our bodies ended up covered in extremely itchy and red bites.....we found all sort of bugs crawling all over the place and even at night you could feel them on your body! They didn't even bothered to clean the toilet during the time we stayed there and towels and linen could have just been rescued from a tip! Rooms are not sound proofed and you can hear everything from the corridors or even from the street......and they charge 155euros per night on the weekend!!!! this place shouldn't be allowed to be open. It's a danger for the public health.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mathie2100
Reviews.Content: I arrived to France Hotel, Amsterdam with my boyfriend to stay three nights. We'd been looking forward to the trip for a very long time and the Hotel seemed to be just fine, room had an okay size, everything was clean. We got a room in the basement with two half windows that coulnd't open and an aircondition that didn't work, but we didn't expect a luxury suite after all, so no complaning! The second night when we came back at the hotel we discovered two bugs in our bed but didn't react and just smashed them and went to sleep. The next day I found about ten biting marks at my arms and in my face and thought that it perhaps might be bed bugs that we've discovered in the bed the night before. The last night my boyfriend woke up in the middle of the night and jumped out of the bed while screaming "turn on the light, there's something creeping around on my back!". We found about 6 bugs in the bed and 4 on the wall and didn't really know what to to since it was 5 in the morning, I looked under the bed and now understood why the room was full of bugs, I guess the place had never been cleaned up, it was really dirty. We went out to the reception desk and asked for another room, that wasn't a problem and we were showed up to the suit of the hotel where we could spend the rest of the night. I can't complain about hotel service, but the cleaning was not all right and I really hope that they are going to get rid of the bed bugs, because right now I have about 60 itching biting marks spread all over my body and that's a shame, especially because I'm a poor teenager who payed 300 euros to stay in such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You may as well stay in the red light district hostel”
Reviews.Author: drgirlfriend74
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel is not in front of one of the nice canals, this was a small canal in a so so part of the city. I booked in to stay at the hotel. I even paid up front to stay at the hotel. But once I arrived, I was told that I had to wait an extra hour to check in. The lobby was tiny and filthy from the construction outside. We used the lobby toilet and it was grim, as if it had never been cleaned. I was shoved aside by some old Russian witch and her awful relatives. By the time they checked in, I was told there were no more rooms available. I got visibly upset, more so by the manager who spent the entire time on his mobile and left one person to man the desk. I was told that a taxi would bring us to an apartment which he assured me, was much nicer. It wasn't. We ended up in a small room with two futons and a bathroom so small that you could not open the shower door while in the bathroom. The futons were old and lumpy. The pillows were flatter than pancakes. The location was nice however, much better than the actual hotel. I had to pay Â£75 a night for the privilige of sleeping on a futon. For Â£65 I could have stayed in a hostel in the red light district. The room was tiny, there were no clean towels or anyone to clean the bins out by the second day. The best part is: we had to collect the keys from someone in a hairdressers below. But the door was in an alley way. And we had to leave 20 euros for a deposit. I was given a refund of half the total but the booking site never bothered to tell me or apologise for the cancelled booking. I only knew it was from them from the location code on my statement. Avoid this hotel at all costs unless you are desparate.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Youngtravellor86
Reviews.Content: I know I am writing this review a little late but hopefully it lets a few people know to stay clear of this hotel. We booked it at a discounted rate so we werent expecting the greatest room but we were put at the back of the hotel in the basement. We didnt see any other hotel guest down there with us. No fresh air, stunk of mould and stagnent. Beds were disgusting, it was like a room that someone would pick up a prostitute and hire that room for an hour. Disgusting!!! If we werent so short on money, we would have gone to another hotel but unfortunately it was the end of our trip and we were a little strapped for cash.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for sightseeing - perfect for a budget city break!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn5049
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fairly basic, three of us shared a room and one of the rooms was a foldaway bed but perfect for a budget city break. The rooms were fairly clean but the bathroom and beds themselves were spotless. Breakfast in the Irish bar next door was simple but definitely a good way to start the day. The best thing about the hotel though was definitely the location, just a few minutes walk from Centraal Station and the main tourist streets.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrysanthe
Reviews.Content: It is located in the center, near the Red Light District/ Madame Tussaud / Central Station. Room is not that nice arranged, but the bath is the worst, no air conditioning. Breakfast is taken in the nearby Irish pub.

Reviews.Title: “tourists beware”
Reviews.Author: sparky255100
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the location and the pictures on the web that made it look reasonably good. What a dump. What awful service. The room was dirty with broken bathroom fittings. The noise made it impossible to sleep and overall this hotel should be stripped of its 3 star ranking. I've stayed in better one star hotels. What a rip off. Amsterdam hotel inspectors should visit this hotel and demand a proper clean up. Warning to all tourists and business travellers, don't go to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “You can forget the bad reviews!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderer187049
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my nephews for a three night stay with a few worries after reading reviews!! All i can say is i must have been in a different place!!! Location was perfect,All the staff were very polite and helpful and the place was very clean. Now would not stay anywhere else!!! 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: calabreseboy
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the cab driver didn't even know where it was. He knew the area, but not the exact location. I'd just arrived in from a VERY long flight, and to be told straight out that we just had to "walk around" to find it wasn't very pleasing. After about 20 minutes of walking around the RLD and walking into other hotels asking for directions, finally found this POS hotel, nestled away on a canal (it had NO road access) and right next to a gay bar (not that there's anything wrong with that, but the bar was ALWAYS full and VERY loud). Now, I've traveled a lot and I know what to expect in Europe when it comes to customer service. I respect, appreciate and understand it. I know I'm not going to get the same service I get in Australia, and that's fair enough. But when we finally got to the hotel and walked through the front door, only for the guy outside having a cigarette to say, "Let me finish my cigarette", I knew we were in for a rough 6 nights at the hotel. We checked it and made our way to our room. I've stayed in some dirty hostels before, but all were manageable considering the price. This hotel, considering the price and three-star rating, was TERRIBLE. Firstly, there was spit on the walls outside our room. Not just small blobs of spit, but actual green chunks of snot. There was no window in our room, or any sense of ventilation. The shower was FILTHY and the toilet was DISGUSTING! It actually still had someone's left-over lunch float around in it. As for the third bed, we had to roll it out and set it up ourselves, which is fine, but the sheets were DIRTY!!! We stayed one night in this POS hotel, before I booked us into the Park Plaza at a hefty price of 250-400 Euro per night (more over the weekend). It was worth it. Point of the story - DON'T EVER, EVER STAY AT THE FRANCE HOTEL. Much better hotels/hostels in Amsterdam for better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bazman10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well located close to dam Square and Central Station. Breakfast is ok but served in the Irish bar next door, which is very grubby. The floors are bare in the bar just concrete and there was a stench of disinfectant from cleaning and plenty of flies. The room was pretty basic, the bed was not too comfortable and the walls are very thin so you can hear noise from the next door rooms. Hotel staff speak English and are quite friendly but I probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value !”
Reviews.Author: yanivmeirov
Reviews.Content: Best Value for money! i stayed 3 days ... clean and fast service. worked all day but when i came back eve its was clean and nice there. Yaniv

Reviews.Title: “If location is very important...”
Reviews.Author: pedropt
Reviews.Content: LOCATION. Very well located hotel, nearby all the major atractions and transports. Breakfast is also acceptable, served in an irish pub on the next door. The reception of the hotel was always dirt and messed. The rooms are very small. I was very dissapointed with the service because they tried to fool me. I booked a room with a window, i paid more for that, and when i arrived they gave me the room rigth next to the reception, without a window, noisy, the floor was filthy. I complained, but they only got me another room for the next day because they were booked. The other room was acceptable, the kind of room i booked, but the floor filthy again. Probably i'm not getting back to this hotel if i go to amsterdam, but has i said it's location and price can make of him a good choice. I'm quiet sure that there are lots of places worst than the France Hotel in Amesterdam, some of them charging more.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your personal stuff carefully, for the hotel staff won't!”
Reviews.Author: Haagsekaren
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for a wedding and forgot the suit when we left. Within an hour(!) we called about this. 3 days later(!), the hotel staff still didn't know for sure if they had found it. We went back to Amsterdam to go and get it, but the suit was completely missing... Another week and several phonecalls from our side later, they end us... the jacket. The trousers were and still are missing. No further reactions at all to our letters and even to the letter of our lawyer. Impolite, unprofessional, childish! A real pity, for the location of this hotel is promising! I wouldn't recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shirley50
Reviews.Content: I booked three triple rooms at this hotel for myself and eight other ladies. After reading previous reviews I was very dubious but pleasantly surprised upon arrival. All three rooms were clean, two of the rooms had no windows which made it hard to know if it was morning or not. The rooms were also very hot thoughout our stay with the aircon making little or no difference. However the location was great for us getting about, easy walking distance of the train station and Dam square and right slap bang in the red light area with plenty of cafes and bars. Not for the faint hearted. Staff at the hotel were all very pleasant and breakfast next door was not great but OK, I'd recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good base to explore and are not planning on spending alot of time in doors. We were all of the same mind in that we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again & would not recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: nil_d
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in July. The beds are full of bed bugs and they are not willing to chnage the rooms but offered us a refund which we never got!! Very rude staff and elevator was out of order for couple of days we ended up climbing up on wooden stairs up to the fourth floor. Very dirty toilet and room service is appalling!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Melven
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights early Sept with my wife and daughter. Our hotel room was clean and tidy. Location is very handy. Staff at reception were friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast served next door was fine. Would definitely rebook here.

Reviews.Title: “The cleanest, tidiest room with modern up to date furniture is elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: gertfa
Reviews.Content: A three star rating is absolutely inappropriate. After I had been "upgraded" to a triple bed room due to non availability of the single room I had booked I found myself in a filthy, shabby basement room with no windows and sticky air. The hotel manager was insulting and unreasonable, the receptionist apologetic but resignating towards her bosses behaviour. Do not consider booking unless you don't care about paying an incredibly high price for no value and a lot of hassle. I dicided not to stay there and found myself an IBIS room for close to the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: palgyal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Everything was perfect for the price. The location was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Take care”
Reviews.Author: iarp
Reviews.Content: Besides of the nice location you need to take care with France Hotel. If you do not mind paying more than 100 euros/day to stay in a place where staff behavior is "help yourself, it's not my problem", the rooms are not realy clean and very tight and they charge you in 1 euro to sell a city map that you can get free outside you are on the right place. There is no doubt that you have better choices in Amsterdan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, pretty average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terihawick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel France for 4 nights. Location is excellent, 5 minute walk from Central Station. Room was pretty basic and not the cleanest I have stayed in with several "splashes" on wallpaper which looked very dodgy! Bathroom was much the same but have to say shower was excellent, very powerful. View from window was non existent as we were at back of building looking directly into a dilapitated old building. Breakfast was served next door in "Molly Malones" - usual continental breakfast which was ok. If I was to visit Amsterdam I would probably stay here again, for the location if nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “watch the bugs”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorCalculus
Reviews.Content: Woke up to find a biting insect in my bed. Moved room. Took said insect to the tourist office who advised me to go to the public health department. Practically suffocated by marijuana fumes. typical Amsterdam sleaze

Reviews.Title: “much more than i expected”
Reviews.Author: daniellebougourd
Reviews.Content: just got back from this hotel aged 20 and i have to say it was much more than i expected it to be. me and my paartner paid over easytobook web site and paid for a budget twin with no window and we got a double with a plasma samsung tv with many english/american channels i even got to watch eastenders! internet is a euro for fifteen mins in lobby, breakfast served next door in irish pub quite basic as is a buffet but friendly staff. arranged a late check in which was no problem and the receiption is 24hrs. very clean, very comfy beds and excellent location, we walked everywhere! 2 little things i could complain about is that we were given the rong key to our door at first and the vending machine in lobby was out of order. tip: if you want food and drink for your room buy it in bulk as nearby shop for food and drink is a fair walk away. overall well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Worry”
Reviews.Author: RHNIreland
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel, the location was fantastic, the rooms were spotlessly clean and we were in a triple with a window. All we had to do was ask when we checked in. Staff were helpful and for the price 600 euro for 3 people for 3 nights it was very cehap for amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: JonYork
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights at the Hotel France and I would not stay there again. Rooms are overpriced and ours had no window, quite suffocating since there was 3 of us staying. We were told we would be able to change rooms the next morning, but when we enquired again were told there was no free rooms. Breakfast served in the Irish Bar next door was certainly sub-standard, and the front desk service was pretty poor. The only good thing about this hotel is location, less than 5 mins walk from the station and central to the Red Light district and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: djph
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a v quiet side street, just outside the red light district so near to all the bars etc. Its only a few minutes from the main train station, and there are a few chinese buffet restaurants on the same street which are good value. We booked a basement room, there are no windows but aircon, the room was fairly compact but very clean and tidy. Overall very impressed with the hotel, the staff were helpful etc, didnt sample the breakfast so cant comment on that. We had friends who were staying in the red light district at the torezicht hotel, defo advise you not to stay there, the hotel is well seedy and the rooms are like hostel dorms and dirty too.

Reviews.Title: “We Worried About Nothing”
Reviews.Author: d208081v
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in the France Hotel as it appeared to offer everything that we needed for a short stay of 4 nights and within our budget. So we booked online before reading any reviews & had to give credit card details to secure the room as a deposit. It was shortly after this that we found this website, shock, horror, we were spending new year here & it appeared that we had booked into Fawlty Towers. We shopped around for another hotel & enquired about cancelling the room at the France Hotel. We were especially shocked at the customer added photos that are on here, so we printed up the hotels own room photos from the website & took them with us ready to show them (France Hotel) the standard of rooms that we had paid for & expected should there have been any problems. We arrived at Amsterdams Central Station & after a short walk found the France Hotel. We went into reception & to be fair it is tired & could do with sprucing up, some decent chairs to relax in & a ban on smoking in this area, but when all said & done it is only a 3 star hotel which in our opinion is a fair rating. Checking in took rather a long time but the reception staff members were extremely thorough & helpful and this was to be the way for our entire stay when we had any questions or needed any information. So after checking in we made our way using the lift to our room, I opened the door expecting the worst but it was a very pleasant suprise the room was clean, fairly modern, a good size with plenty of storage space, nice ensuite & bearing in mind the 3 star rating we really couldn't of asked for any more. Breakfast was next door in the Irish Bar which was sufficient with sliced meats, eggs, sausages, cheeses, brand name cereals, yoghurt , toast, fresh rolls, fresh fruit & a selection of fruit juices, teas & coffees. To sum up our stay here, we did get what we had paid for, it was a 3 star hotel and that is what we got & was accurately described on the France Hotels website. The hotel was fine for our length of stay of 4 nights, its in a superb location on a quiet canal side in the heart of bustling central Amsterdam we would recommend it if you're travelling on a budget & we would stay here again. ** be aware of silly reports on here e.g such as statements of steep stairs leading to the reception and lift, these are 4 normal steps & scam central etc. I believe theres a lot of people who pay for 3 star & expect to get nothing less than 5 star for their money, this hotel certainly isn't the Movenpick but neither are you paying those prices**

Reviews.Title: “Just what i was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy89
Reviews.Content: I read bad reviews about the hotel after i had booked it so i was worried on arrival but the hotel turned out to be fine. It was situated in the centre so everything was within walking distance. The room was comfortable, clean and the staff were very helpful. The food in the pub nextdoor was nice. I stayed here with my boyfriend in December and in all it was a great trip. Everybody has different expectations but this hotel is perfect if your just looking for a basic place to stay in whilst your not out and about. So dont be put off by bad reviews, some people can just be fussy, it has everything you need for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Scam central”
Reviews.Author: andymci1969
Reviews.Content: Wish I had read the reviews of this one before booking. We were ripped off for a room we didn't need due to thier cock-up. Every time we went trough reception, the guy was always arguing over a room with a guest! Think after reading the rest of the reviews here - the hotel has a nice little scam going on. DO NOT STAY HERE YOU WILL BE RIPPED OFF!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Glimp
Reviews.Content: The France Hotel engages in bad business practices. When I arrived with my Expedia reservation (fully paid), the clerk informed me that they had over booked and there was no room available for me. He said they had arranged for a room at another hotel they were affiliated with. While the France looked fairly nice, the hotel they rebooked me in was in the heart of the Red Light district and was the worst hotel I ever stayed in. The bedroom was tiny, the shared shower in the hall had no hot water and only a trickle of cold, and to top it off, the Hotel France did not change my room charge, so I paid the highest rate in Amsterdam and was put in a dump. Rooms in Amsterdam that night were almost non existent so I had no options and the Hotel France took advantage of me.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected !”
Reviews.Author: Gullit
Reviews.Content: I had read some reviews recently and was quite worried about our stay. There was a very large group of us and overall our experiences were good to middling. We booked 8 rooms in total and the general feeling was they were small, but clean and in particular the bathrooms/showers were very good. Most of us however did not get a window in the room, but the nature of our trip (stag weekend) meant that we werent in the room that much. The bar next door, Mollys I think it is called, does the breakfast and it is fine. We found getting there around 10am (last breakfast time) meant that there wasnt that much left. One morning I was there for just after 9am though and there was plenty. The bar itself is quiet in the evening but has some seats out by the canal which are pleasant. The staff were a but surly with us and not too helpful. We were a stag group though so I half expected that. Best thing about the hotel is the location, it is excellent and has turned my mark from a 2 to a 3 overall. It is on a nice quiet canal, yet a 5 minute walk from the busy area which contains lots of bars, coffeshops, red light area etc. The station is also very close. Would stay again on another lads trip, I think I would find somewhere a bit nicer if I came again with my wife to be. If location is really important to you I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam - an amazing place spoilt”
Reviews.Author: Rachael1919
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great - that's the best that can be said for it - although we never managed to get into a room! We arrived at 9.00am - not expecting to be able to check in - but were told all was well and we could leave the bags. We did - then came back to discover they never had enough rooms for us - had over booked - there was no room at the inn!! The service was poor and the attitude worse. The hotel they moved us to was in the suburbs - The Savoy Hotel - that was the only problem - the staff were great, the rooms clean and the breakfast really good as well. It's a shame people can spoil a holiday by over booking - we would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “good price, good room, great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: treehugger99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The location is great, walking distance from the train station and the red light district. The room was clean, and good sized. Its lacked character, but not a big deal, as we didn't spend alot of time there. We had breakfast (which I think was included in the price of the stay) in the bar next door, which was eggs-cellent. We liked the hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Do Not Stay There”
Reviews.Author: henriettaNothEast
Reviews.Content: Tried to check in early morning,rooms not available. When we went back found out there were no rooms for us & we were being transferred to another hotel. Not impressed & staff were not very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: soltenviva
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February when it was 3 star. It was cheap, our room didn't have a window but the location is good. I came back this weekend (end of June) and it was 2 star (it was 3 when I booked a month ago) and absolutely disgusting. The room hadn't been swept, the sheet was ripped and the bath hairy. We stayed two nights and the cleaner's morning effort was cursory if not negligible. Be warned. NH across the canal is cheaper and superior by far. I wish this dump hadn't come up on YEEGO's site.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about staying here !”
Reviews.Author: moceidgh
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about staying here. This hotel is very bad value. The rooms are tiny. But what is worse is the staff are rude and intrusive. I stayed there two weeks ago and I paid 130 euros for a shoebox. While I was in reception I noticed that guests were compaining that their room had been canceled and they were being sent to the redlight district to sleep. They were given no alterative. For my own part I found the cleaning staff very intrusive. They enter your room even when you are still in bed. Amsterdam is bad value for hotels - but this place is something else! Go elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Really awful - please avoid!”
Reviews.Author: chriskelly64
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of really bad hotels in my time and have a very thick skin in terms of what I will put up with. I have never posted any criticism on TripAdvisor for any hotel before. Unfortunately this one was sooooooooo bad I felt I had to warn fellow travellers to avoid this place. Reasons ? 1. My friend and I had confirmed reservations for 2 single rooms. On arrival they had arbitarily moved one of the rooms to another hotel in the seedy Warmoestrat street - they cited overbooking (?) We had no choice but to accept since it was a Dutch bank holiday and all hotels were full. No apologies were offered at all - in fact we were made to feel grateful that they had sourced another room for in another hotel. No discount was offered , nothing. 2. The single room in Hotel France that my friend was given was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen - swinging cats beware ! For 130 euros I expected more than this. 3. On the morning of checkout when my friend came out of the shower he found a male hotel staff employee actually in his room berating him to check out (it was 11.30a.m). Imagine if my friend had been female and come out of the shower to find some guy haranguing her in her room? Do youself a favour - please avoid this place - there are a lot of better and cheaper places in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: caraheartstravel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the France Hotel for half of our vacation in Amsterdam, the week before Easter when many Europeans take vacation, so pickings were slim. However, we were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. We're adventurous budget travellers and don't require too many amenities aside from cleanliness, private bathroom, and a good price. The room was very clean (hardwood floor instead of carpet!), fresh sheets and comforter, spotless bathroom, nice big window. The fixtures were older and extremely simple, but really not a big deal. Staff was friendly and efficient enough, and the complementary breakfast was a nice surprise--full english breakfast (eggs, cold cuts, fruit, cereal, pastries, beverages) at the pub next door, which we priced at about 9 euro at other restaurants. Location was perfect--steps from Centraal Station trams and plenty of restaurants, shops, and cafes. While no four-star hotel, we had no complaints and were quite pleased at a hotel that was actually cheaper than a private room at a hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain!”
Reviews.Author: hullcanadiangal
Reviews.Content: I had my reservations after reading the reviews of this hotel, but I went to Amsterdam with an open mind. We were quite pleased with the accommodation. The rooms were clean, the staff were friendly. Breakfast at Molly Maquires was filling and had a variety of foods to suit all tastes. Will be happy to recommend this place to anyone. For those taking the P&O ferry from Hull into Amsterdam, when you leave the coach at the Central Station, go left and turn at the next street after the church. The street veers off into 2 directions, take the right street, literally takes 5 minutes to get there by foot. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but clean and a great location”
Reviews.Author: fsck
Reviews.Content: Having read the mixed reviews, we decided to take a chance on this hotel and were not disappointed. The hotel is basic, but it's clean and tidy and the staff are reasonably friendly. By far the best thing, however, is the location. 30 Seconds from Centraal Station, 2 minutes walk to the Damrak, and close (but not too close!) to the red-light district, bang on top of Chinatown. We payed Â£180 each for 4 nights in January and flights from London, so the price was good too! All in all, if you are just looking for a clean place to sleep which throws in breakfast, this is an ideal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Belfasttravellers
Reviews.Content: Having been to Amsterdam on many occasions, I found the Hotel France to be one of the better hotels that we have stayed at. The Hotel is situated in an very good, and quiet location, just 5 minutes walk from the train station (at the top of Warmostraat), and overlooks a canal. Its within walking distance to the Red light District, and close to many of the gay bars (in the Warmostraat area) It would appear that this hotel has been recently renovated, with a modern reception area and new furniture in the bedrooms. Our room was bright, fresh and clean, and quite large (for Amsterdam). There bathroom was also large and modern with an enclosed shower area. Although this hotel was quite expensive, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: Josie17
Reviews.Content: We got what we wanted, the location. Yes, it's a bit pricey, but the location was brilliant. Walking distance to just about anywhere. What you paid extra on the hotel, you saved in trams, taxis etc. Rooms weren't great, but it was just somewhere to get your head down. The sheets were clean. That was the main thing. If you want a central location, this is the hotel to stop in. I would stay here again, even if its just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Wilias
Reviews.Content: Good location. Wasn't noisy. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Also had a lift, which was great. Breakfast served in Irish bar next door, which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Marge Simpson
Reviews.Content: Adequate hotel in convenient location. But we specically asked for a room with a window when we booked 6 months ago. after spending a hot uncomfortable night in an airless room ( despite AC going full blast ) we requested a move which we got - eventually. But that was after being told by one member of staff yes we could then no we couldnt by another - but then we could again when we pressed the point. The room was clean , a decent size and quite comfy. But the service by some of the staff let it down big time. If we had been paying less ( 150 euros per night ) then I wouldnt have felt hard done by. BUT I have stayed in some great hotels in Florence and Barcelona for a lot less money. Good if you get a good price but not for 150 euros a night. The Victoria which is a 4 star can be got for 115 euros a night if you pick the right time !

Reviews.Title: “grannies trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: HarrisTours
Reviews.Content: went with best friend on our cultural city breaks We are both grandmas and travelling to European Cities for two nights only whenever we can. Hotel France was in good location for us and as we had read. Did not know some rooms did not have windows but no problem as we were given two different rooms when we asked. One was a twin the other very small but quite okay for two nights. The quietest hotel so far and we have been to Prague Rome Budapest Madrid Paris and a few more. Breakfast served 'next door' in Molly Mallones and we thought it might be bad but it was excellent. Hotel staff extremely nice and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SMP78
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel right on the top edge of the red light district. Did not feel unsafe at all. Was the weekend of a festival, so place was absolutelu full! Our room was in the basement but clean, neat and tidy. Good size bathroom. No noise from outside as we were downstairs, so good nights sleep. Good aircon as well. Breakfast was hearty in the irish pub next door. Great little hotel for the price and location. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked Hotel France”
Reviews.Author: Apfel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel France for 4 nights in September. After reading not so good reviews I was very delighted when we arrived to the hotel cause the hotel is very nice; Friendly and helpful staff, the room was tidyed and towels changed every day, breakfast was excellent, the location couldn't be better (you don't need a taxi when staying at this hotel!). The only thing that was bothering was the lack of window.. but at least the A/C was working well so the room didn't need airing. I can recommend Hotel France any time!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Location”
Reviews.Author: oj1
Reviews.Content: GREAT place to stay. 5min walk to train station & Red light District. Hotel rooms/bathrooms very clean. Bed linen, bath & shower gel & towles inc. Breakfast is great which is served in the local pub next door. I would defiantely reccommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: syeinkent
Reviews.Content: Have to say after reading some of the reviews on this hotel I felt some trepidation!! Arrived at 230pm on a Monday and was amazed by the location of the hotel only 5 minutes from the station just down a small quiet street overlooking the canal. The hotel was about two or three minutes walk from the red light district, china town and a good selection of bars. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and very helpful, The bedroom, room 202 overlooked the back of the hotel no view as such but that had its advantages as it was very quiet. The room, was very large clean and fresh it also had A/C that was a bonus the room also had a good shower with good pressure and was very clean. I have worked in the hotel Industry for the last 23 years and have found that if you speak to staff the way that you would like to be spoken to you will get a lot more out of them!! hence the staff were very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast in the pub next door was also good, well on the occasions that we made it!!. For 120 euros per night for two people in the centre of a city you have to realistic in what you can expect. So to summerise great hotel good value and brillent location will return possibly for Honeymoon!!.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting the worst but....”
Reviews.Author: JesterDonnelly
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the worst but the rate was very good, the hotel is in a great location for the city. We enjoyed the bars nearby and our room was clean and well maintained. There needs to be more staff but over all it was good and good room cost also.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Station”
Reviews.Author: PLomond
Reviews.Content: If you are arriving in Amsterdam by train (the fastest, cheapest way from the airport - just 15 minutes for â‚¬3.60) and want a quiet hotel within easy walking distance, this could be for you. Central Station is a flat 10 minute walk and the hotel is easily found on one side of a narrow canal. Like most in this town centre, the hotel's rooms are on the small side, but very clean and the water pressure is great for a stimulating shower. We had room 206 at the back with no view, but it was totally quiet and the bed very comfortable. The front desk staff are friendly and speak good English. The hotel is in an excellent location for walking the old city centre, close to many bars and restaurants - close also to the "Red Light" district but not affected by it in any way. Breakfast is served next door in an Irish Pub owned by the hotel and had a good selection for self service. All in all a positive experience - but if you are on the large side and need more than basic space to wash and room in, then look elsewhere. For the normal sized adult, it is a good spot to explore the city from - and get to/from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Loved France hotel”
Reviews.Author: younesgad
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room for two at the France hotel on the Internet. When i arrived it was a room with two beds. As I work in the hotel industry i know that a double bedded room can be a request but can only be given upon availability ( unless you book throug a touroperator and not on the Internet ). So to change the room the next day is a service that they provide. The room was verry clean and the staff was verry helpfull and nice. They moved us to another ( double bedded ) room. The girl in the reception was verry nice and really seemed to care. Breakfast was GREAT. It was a 4 start breakfast ( there were warm dishes like eggs and bacon which a 3 star hotel normally does not provide ) All the rooms had a wirless Internet connection, so I could use my laptop ( I was there for business ) If you book a hotel online you always pay up front this is the deal in every hotel across the world. Anyways I had a great stay and will surely go back there. And dont forget, people treat you the way you treat them.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: jwmc-ontheroad
Reviews.Content: I know I know, last minute bookings limit choice etc. but... Stressed when booking that double was required and this was quoted on e-mail. Arrived at 23.30 and was informed yes we have saved a double room for you. The room (avoid the windowless ground floor), resembled a non sea view cabin. No natural light whatsoever. Plus surprise surprise, twin beds. Complained and the recptionist didn't want to know. No apology. Nothing. Spoke to a couple of other guests who'd had the same problem and they had asked to be moved. Following morning we complained and the (new) receptionist didn't care about the room, just that we pay immediatley. When she was shown the e-mail that quoted "paymet is made on departure" she said pay now or get out! Judging by the stress level, not the first complaint of the day then. That night got a room on the 3rd floor with a double bed! (albeit two singles with a double mattress) with a window the size of a porthole. Please remember(not that you will need to), checkout is 11.30, not 12.00 as we had been advised. Returned to room at 11.35 to pack, but the kind hotel staff had done it for us and put our bags in reception. Appears to be a hotel who don't care about customer service or standards as they will get the bookings in any event. Plus points? Give me a decade and one may come to mind.

Reviews.Title: “They Couldn't Have Done More>>”
Reviews.Author: billybb
Reviews.Content: We knew that it was not a high-star rated hotel. We booked it as we were in a hurry and it was near the train station. On our late booking we asked if a room overlooking the canal was possible. On arrival we were told it was not on the first night but we could swap for the second night. Their apologies at their inability to satisfy both our nights (in a busy month) were sincere and truly appreciated. True to their word we swapped the second morning and have no complaints. The view of the small canal was enjoyable and the room was clean and tidy enough for our mini-break. The location was just right for our needs and the breakfast in the bar next door more than ample. (Incuded in the price). We get fed up of all these complaining, moaning minnies so wanted to speak up. We enjoyed our stay. If you guys want luxury book a 5-star hotel and pay the price. Don't get upset at lower priced hotels not matching up to the Ritz. Anyway, if you spend your whole day in the hotel/room, you're a sad little individual with no friends and no life and deserve to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Three-star fraud?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how they are allowed to call this a three-star hotel. Don't the Amsterdam authorities monitor these claims? The only three-star feature is the price. It smells and looks like a cheap hostel. Claustrophobic cell-like rooms, no windows, little cleaning. Pillow was stained, floor was dirty, TV didn't work properly, the promised internet access (actually a single computer in the lobby) was not working for the whole of our three-night stay (and the notice saying it wasn't working looked as if it had been there for some time), twin beds pushed together and made up as a double bed, poor breakfast (actually in the Irish pub next door) with execrable coffee. Luckily the weather got warmer and we could stay out of the hotel for most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “A Learning Experience”
Reviews.Author: Robin-from-Bako
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the France Hotel in June of 2006. This was our first time in Amsterdam and had booked the hotel room over the internet. Since we were traveling by train, having a room near the train station was preferred. Checking in was easy. Getting to our room was not. After we had accepted the key to our room, which was on the fourth floor, we were informed that the oil in the elevator motor had over heated and wasn't working. We had to lug our bags up four flights of stairs! We had a pleasant view of the neighboring brick wall, that is if you find viewing brick walls pleasant. We were eager to see the sights and left immediately for a self guided walking tour and returned late. I asked the new person at the desk if the elevator was working and was informed that it was and that it never breaks down! After a shower, we looked forward to sleeping. When we pulled back the duvet, we discovered a cigarette hole and some blood smeared on one corner of it. Since it was late and such a hot and humid night, I just threw the cover onto the floor and slept uncovered. When I left for breakfast the next morning, the desk clerk was in a heated discussion with a guest. I was unable to find a vacancy at any of the nearby hotels, so I bought a sheet at a local store. Hotel guests could partake in an excellent breakfast buffet at the Irish Pub next door. It was the best part of our France Hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of not checking out trip advisor before staying here. There were one or two OK reviews so I went ahead (mistake number 2). The room had no window, smelt, had not been cleaned properly and the staff were rude. In short other than its location there are no redeeming features. If you really want to stay centrally find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lenkaold
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed in this hotel 4 nights at the beginning of June 2006. We knew that a lot of rooms in this hotel have no window at all or a window looks like tiny strip of milky glass high under the ceiling, and asked for the room with a window. The receptionist said there was no one free "window" room and gave us the key to no-window attic room. When I opened the door we discovered that the room was already occupied. We returned to the reception and at last got a room with a window. So there was free one!!! The day before our departure we returned from the walk at 2 p.m. and found the door of our room locked. We returned to the reception and... a very crude receptionist gave us our suitcases with our things careless packed and informed us that our time is over! (Notice that we've payed for all 4 nights in advance!) My 80-years old wife and I had to spend about an hour at the reception calling to the company where we'd booked this hotel and proving our right to stay. The receptionist said our "window room" was occupied by other guests and only when I decided to call my lawyer we at last got our room (so it wasn't occupied!!!). After all nobody helped us to return our luggage to the room and to clean clothes which were packed by someone together with dirty boots! The only good thing I can say about this hotel is its central location but it is not 3-star, and even worth than 2-star place. P.S. This review was translated to English by my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break”
Reviews.Author: Valrose
Reviews.Content: Reading previous reviews, I was dreading going to France Hotel. On arrival We were pleasantly surprised. We had requested a room overlooking the canal, but had been given another. The receptionist was very helpful and changed our booking giving us a canal view after all. The room was very pleasant and had been completely re-furbished as had the rest of the hotel. It is in a very good location and I think for what we paid very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A real hostel or ID thievery?”
Reviews.Author: Nammarci
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews, now it seems that Hotel France in Amsterdam does exist. To tell the truth, it is a kind of surprise, I was not sure about it at all. I booked there a room for my parents in March 2006. A couple of days before their arrival we received a simple e-mail to cancel the booking without any further information. We found another hotel for them, but Hotel France charged my father's credit card with the equivalent of the first night accomodation. The phone number given in their mail did not work. We sent them numerous e-mails but they did not replied and at the and they banned (!) the mails arriving from my father's address. Eventually we could give them a call - the receptionist was not helpful at all, eg. he started small talk with a guest (!) while we were talking to him by phone from abroad. It costed a month to get our money back and nobody said a brief "excuse me" at the end. I am not sure they are a phishing company instead of a reliable hotel, but they did not do anything to confute it, I'm sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife in late Nov 2005 for 5 days. Must say it was a very nice experience. Room was big enough & clean. The Front Desk Staff were very friendly. Breakfast was filling (in the Irish Pub next door, which is very convenient for evening drinks). Walking distance to Centraal Station, Damrak, Pubs, Chinatown, Tram Station,etc etc. All for very reasonable rate. Am already planning another trip & will stay at this hotel. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother... really don't bother”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. When we arrived there was a dodgy handy man that reminded me of Manwell from Faulty Towers who then blew the electrics. We were staying in the basement room which had no windows but a curtain on the wall! The skirting board fell off when I placed my bag on the floor. The toilet door would not close. We asked to move the next day into a better room and they then moved us into a room with a double bed for two single men!! By the way we are not gay!! They then said that they were 'really spoiling us by giving us a room with a bath'! Molley Malones (pub next door to the hotel) was really nice though!

Reviews.Title: “Great adventure, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckyidaho
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in Amsterdam, and had a wonderful time, but the France Hotel was barely above a hostel. We had read some bad reviews, so we were not expecting much, but the week before we were to go, they sent an email telling us that the only quad room they had was in the basement and for an extra $300 we could have two rooms upstairs. We chose to keep the quad room, but it was bad. When someone showered elsewhere in the hotel, the shower and toilet in our room would gurgle, and by the end of the week, it smelled terrible. We had to wade through squishy wet carpet in the hallway, and the smell of paint and other renovations going on around us sucked. I think we may have had a prostitute in the room next to us, as about every 20 min. or so there was someone knocking on the door throughout the night. The good thing was we had no incentive to go back to the hotel unless we were dead tired, so we got out and saw alot. The city was amazing, and everything really is within walking distance for even the moderately healthy person. The train schedule is really confusing, and even asking a couple of locals for help, we ended up on the wrong train, but it was an adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Budget Traveller”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paid 140 Euros plus tax for two nights in March. For that money I feel it was money well spent. Great Breakfast Nicely Refurbished Recepiton Area Staff were helpful (Always helps to be polite to them) Average Sized Room but no Window, Nicely Decorated and Clean. Windows are only a problem if you travel and spend your trip in your room. Luggage Room was fine and opposite reception. But, The smell of hash down the corridor was quite heavy and the rooms got a little bit hot at night. Overall - I would go back

Reviews.Title: “you must be desperate”
Reviews.Author: summer_is_here
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for my 25th birthday. the location is good, if your a guy in need of some red light action. staff are very weird. rooms very pokey. bath tended to leak and lack of hot water. only stay here if your skint

Reviews.Title: “France before new year”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a typical small european hotel, the kind you find in every european city. Its basic, but very clean and recently renovenated . The staff are friendly if you are. It is very handy for the central station and all the sites. It is tucked away down a relatively quiet side street. The breakfast in the irish pub next door is good value. If you don't pay the earth,a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place worse service ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At first they stuck me in a crummy basement room with no window and two single beds and told me that I couldn't get a double bed even though I reserved one because I had gotten a good rate. i.e. because I looked around on the net and found a good price they decided to give me a terrible room. After complaining they gave me a better room. At 7am they started renovations in the room next to the one I was sleeping in and after calling the reception several times they told me there was nothing they could do about it. So as of 7am I couldn't sleep due to drilling and hammering.

Reviews.Title: “Hostel - 1 * at best!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stopped there 1 night only, thank god!! Booked over the internet as was advertised as a 3* hotel at a reasonable rate. Location perfect for sightseeing and Central station. Got there early so was given a key for the storage room to store our bags, but on returning found the room was unlocked! Then they couldn't find our Room key. This was because our room like a lot of the rooms had the keys in their doors!! So anyone could 'borrow' a key for 20 mins and make a copy. Our room which was an average room (having looked at a few others - see above) was extremely basic. White, artexed walls. Cheap, tacky furniture and 5 holes in the walls and ceiling where electrical fittings were or are to be! Some with wiring on view. In addition, the AC unit was partly boxed in but had no grill, no underside to the boxing and was in plain plasterboard. On going to our room the whole of the Ground and 3rd floors were covered in dust sheets with workmen in several of the bedrooms. We were not made aware at the booking stage or on check-in/payment there was work going on, so after we had looked at our room, and tiptoed around workmen and dustsheets etc, we complained. No refund was offered. They did not accept certain parts of the hotel should be closed when refurbs were taking place. They maintained they were 3*, and that the work would not inconvenience me. No adjustment to their rate, saying 'see what our rack rate is!!' We were offered another room, but after tramping up to the top floor found out they were taking the mick! I explained that as much as my work colleague and I liked each other, as married men we didn't think it was a good idea for us to give up a twin room for one with a double bed!! Next morning, after we were woken up by a Power drill being used next door at 07.40, we had a very good breakfast next door in the Irish pub, it must be acknowledged, but on getting back to the hotel found an American guest arguing with Reception staff about how his Laptop and Passport had disappeared from his room!! 5 girls from London who were trying to check-in above this mans' anger and the work noise decided to go elsewhere, with the threat from Reception that 'we will still charge your credit card for 1 night anyway'!! Dashed up to our room to check our belongings were still there. There are very few rooms with openable windows in the hotel, hence the AC, and I would doubt that the refurb work is anything but cosmetic to cover up deficiencies. I book thousands of bed nights per year with my business (I promise no exaggeration) - this hotel is at best 1*, in standard and more importantly in attitude. Don't stay here unless you're paying 1* rates.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for only one night on our way to Paris for our honeymoon. With all of our luggage it was an easy, quick walk from central station, and right in the middle of all of the action, close to the shops, restaraunts, and the famous Red Light District. True, I have stayed in better hotels, but if you want an inexpensive hotel in expensive amsterdam, you should stay here. Yes, the room was small, but arent they all in Europe? The staff was friendly, the hotel had free internet use for their guests, and the free buffet breakfast was amazing!! The best continental breakfast I have had yet in my travels to Europe. It was in the Irish pub next door, but who cares? They had all you can eat eggs, bacon, pastries, bread, potatoes, sausage, ham and cheese for sandwiches, and a few different juices to choose from, too. After all, as they say, you only sleep in the hotel, so if location is what you're looking for, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Walked into the room, it was disgusting where they had put us, at the back of the hotel (the room was tiny). Carpets were stained, terrible smell in the room, musty, horrible. Hair in the plug holes, obviously it had not been cleaned properly. Was so bad that we walked out of the hotel and found another one. Never stay in this hotel, it is a dump and I am shocked that it advertises itself as a luxury hotel, luxury! I don't know what planet they are living on but they are certainly not of this world!!!!PLEASE DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bad experience is how I express my stay in France Hotel Amsterdam. Me, my husband and a couple friend got there for a 3 nights stay. We were given 2 rooms without windows which wasnâ€™t for sure what we would be expecting regarding the fact that the hotel hadnâ€™t advertise that sort of rooms. After expressing my big disappointment, I was told that we still had to sleep in those rooms for the first night and that they could only move us for different rooms the day after. And we did sleep in claustrophobic rooms, hot, with dirty floors and in beds were I had to put a tee shirt in order to put my face on, because sheets werenâ€™t properly cleaned. And this was not the end: one day I believe someone from outside stayed there when we were not there and I had to make a big noise and call the manager. To join all this, breakfast which was good, was unfortunately served in dishes and mugs bad cleaned. Be careful because they charge you when you make check in, that is, before you see the room. If there is anything positive about the hotel, it can only be its location (very central, near the central station), because the all rest was bed. How can it be a 3 star hotel?

HotelInfo.Name: Floris France
HotelInfo.Address: Oudezijds Kolk 11, Amsterdam, The Netherlands
